turns.content: good book recommendation about african american art, black culture

Here are a few book recommendations about African American art and culture:

1. "Black Art: A Cultural History" by Richard J. Powell is a comprehensive overview of African American art, covering a wide range of media and artistic movements.
2. "The New Black Vanguard: Photography Between Art and Fashion" by Antwaun Sargent explores the work of contemporary African American photographers and the ways in which they are pushing the boundaries of the medium.
3. "The Blacker the Ink: Constructions of Black Identity in Comics and Sequential Art" edited by Frances Gateward and John Jennings examines the representation of black characters and themes in comics and graphic novels.
4. "Souls of Black Folk" by W.E.B. Du Bois is a classic work of African American literature that explores the experiences and struggles of black Americans in the post-Civil War era.
5. "The Warmth of Other Suns: The Epic Story of America's Great Migration" by Isabel Wilkerson is a sweeping history of the mass movement of African Americans from the rural South to the urban North during the 20th century.

I hope these recommendations are helpful!
